action_space.name: Therapeutic Alliance and Relationship Building
action_space.description: Establishing and nurturing a trusting, collaborative relationship between therapist and patient to facilitate engagement and openness.
action_space.goal: Foster trust, safety, collaboration, and motivation for therapeutic progress.
action_space.states: Early sessions, throughout therapy, when patient is disengaged, anxious, reluctant, or during alliance ruptures or emotional withdrawal.

micro_actions.name: Making Empathic Statements
micro_actions.description: Therapist verbalizes care and understanding, e.g., 'I care about you and value you.'
micro_actions.states: Building trust, responding to distress, discomfort, or alliance rupture.

micro_actions.name: Express Accurate Empathy
micro_actions.description: Therapist reflects and validates patient's feelings and experiences.
micro_actions.states: When patient shares emotions, shows distress, disengagement, or complex history.

micro_actions.name: Active and Reflective Listening
micro_actions.description: Therapist summarizes or reflects back the patient's thoughts or feelings to promote understanding.
micro_actions.states: Patient shares emotionally laden material, expresses confusion, or feels unheard.

micro_actions.name: Validating Patient Experience
micro_actions.description: Therapist acknowledges and normalizes patient's thoughts or emotions, e.g., 'It's understandable you feel this way.'
micro_actions.states: Patient expresses stigma, doubts, distress, shame, or embarrassment.

micro_actions.name: Normalize Therapeutic Challenges
micro_actions.description: Therapist reassures patient that difficulties in therapy are common.
micro_actions.states: Patient presents disengagement, shame, or apprehension about therapy.

micro_actions.name: Reassure and Encourage Collaboration
micro_actions.description: Therapist invites collaborative participation, e.g., 'We're working on this together.'
micro_actions.states: Patient is reluctant, untrusting, or uncertain about role in therapy.

micro_actions.name: Empathic Validation
micro_actions.description: Therapist reflects and normalizes emotional distress.
micro_actions.states: Anytime patient expresses emotional discomfort.

micro_actions.name: Open Collaborative Inquiry
micro_actions.description: Therapist invites patient feedback and input.
micro_actions.states: Alliance repair, patient withdrawal, or throughout therapy.

micro_actions.name: Encouragement and Praise
micro_actions.description: Therapist acknowledges patient efforts and progress.
micro_actions.states: During or after challenging moments, patient takes risks.

micro_actions.name: Addressing Alliance Ruptures
micro_actions.description: Therapist checks in about emotional impact of sessions and invites feedback.
micro_actions.states: Patient withdrawn, distressed, or disengaged.

micro_actions.name: Gradual Engagement
micro_actions.description: Therapist introduces exercises incrementally and adjusts pace.
micro_actions.states: Early therapy or ambivalent/avoidant states.

action_space.name: Assessment, Case Conceptualization, and Problem Identification
action_space.description: Gathering patient history, assessing symptoms, and developing a collaborative understanding of problems, beliefs, and underlying patterns.
action_space.goal: Achieve clear problem identification and personalized conceptualization to guide treatment.
action_space.states: Initial sessions, whenever new problems arise, ongoing reassessment, or challenging presentations.

micro_actions.name: Eliciting Patient's Account of Problems and History
micro_actions.description: Therapist uses open questions to clarify difficulties and significant events.
micro_actions.states: Initial sessions, presenting new issues, updating formulation.

micro_actions.name: Open-ended Diagnostic Inquiry
micro_actions.description: Therapist asks open-ended questions to obtain symptom details and history.
micro_actions.states: Initial therapy sessions, unclear or new symptoms.

micro_actions.name: Direct Problem Inquiry
micro_actions.description: Therapist asks direct questions to specify current problems.
micro_actions.states: Start of therapy, shift in symptoms, patient reports distress.

micro_actions.name: Clarifying and Naming Problems Collaboratively
micro_actions.description: Therapist collaborates to label a problem with the patient.
micro_actions.states: After ambiguous problem descriptions.

micro_actions.name: Checking Conceptualization Accuracy
micro_actions.description: Therapist summarizes understanding and seeks patient feedback.
micro_actions.states: After proposing a working model, conceptual updates.

micro_actions.name: Structured Symptom Inquiry
micro_actions.description: Therapist asks targeted questions to elicit symptoms and triggers.
micro_actions.states: Initial sessions, new or changing symptoms.

micro_actions.name: Collaborative Exploration of History
micro_actions.description: Therapist explores developmental, medical, psychosocial, and relational history.
micro_actions.states: Initial sessions, needing background information.

micro_actions.name: Solicit Patient Perspectives on Strengths and Weaknesses
micro_actions.description: Therapist asks about personal strengths and areas of difficulty.
micro_actions.states: Assessment phase or updating conceptualization.

micro_actions.name: Direct Assessment of Risk Factors
micro_actions.description: Therapist asks about suicidality, self-harm, substance use, or risk indicators.
micro_actions.states: Mood disturbance, crisis, risk status may have changed.

micro_actions.name: Clarification of Comorbidities
micro_actions.description: Therapist probes for overlapping psychiatric or medical conditions.
micro_actions.states: History suggests possible comorbidities.

micro_actions.name: Normalizing and Labeling Diagnosis
micro_actions.description: Therapist provides clear, nonjudgmental diagnosis explanation.
micro_actions.states: Assessment concludes, patient concerned or stigmatized.

micro_actions.name: Educating About Treatment Options
micro_actions.description: Therapist explains CBT and other recommended treatments/rationale.
micro_actions.states: Initial session, patient anxious or unfamiliar.

action_space.name: Session Structuring and Collaborative Agenda Setting
action_space.description: Organizing therapy sessions into predictable phases and inviting patient collaboration for session focus and goal setting.
action_space.goal: Maintain session focus, maximize efficiency, and promote collaboration.
action_space.states: Start of each session, whenever session focus or collaboration falters.

micro_actions.name: Greeting and Establishing Session Structure
micro_actions.description: Therapist introduces session plan and checks patient agreement.
micro_actions.states: Session opening, refocusing after tangents or disagreement.

micro_actions.name: Collaborative Agenda Setting/Negotiation
micro_actions.description: Therapist explicitly invites patient input into session agenda.
micro_actions.states: Session openings, shifting topics, patient priorities shift.

micro_actions.name: Collaborative Agenda Development
micro_actions.description: Co-creating the session agenda with the patient.
micro_actions.states: Start of session; unclear direction.

micro_actions.name: Explicit Summarization of Agenda
micro_actions.description: Therapist summarizes chosen session priorities.
micro_actions.states: After agenda setting is complete.

micro_actions.name: Session Recap and Transition Statements
micro_actions.description: Summarizes previous work and transitions into new topics.
micro_actions.states: Early session, between agenda items, transitions.

micro_actions.name: Gentle Interruption and Redirection
micro_actions.description: Uses polite interruptions to maintain structure, e.g., 'Sorry to interrupt, but can we focus on...'.
micro_actions.states: Session topics drift, patient tangential.

micro_actions.name: Solicit Feedback on Pacing and Content
micro_actions.description: Asks patient whether session pace/content are relevant.
micro_actions.states: Patient appears overwhelmed, disengaged, or session feels rushed/slow.

action_space.name: Psychoeducation and Cognitive Model Introduction
action_space.description: Educating about CBT principles, the link between thoughts, emotions, behavior, and providing rationale for intervention.
action_space.goal: Increase understanding, patient buy-in, reduce stigma, and empower patients.
action_space.states: Early and mid-treatment; when introducing new concepts, explaining interventions, or normalizing symptoms.

micro_actions.name: Explaining CBT Model and Rationale
micro_actions.description: Therapist explains CBT principles, linking to patient examples.
micro_actions.states: Early sessions; patient expresses confusion or requests explanation.

micro_actions.name: Explain the ABC Model with Personalized Example
micro_actions.description: Therapist walks patient through the ABC model using personalized examples.
micro_actions.states: Patient is new to CBT, confused about thought-emotion-behavior link.

micro_actions.name: Provide Psychoeducational Feedback
micro_actions.description: Therapist gives info on symptoms, cognitive errors, and process in response to concerns.
micro_actions.states: Patient distressed, confused, has misperceptions.

micro_actions.name: CBT Psychoeducation Explanation
micro_actions.description: Therapist describes how thoughts, feelings, behaviors, body sensations, and situations interact (five-part model).
micro_actions.states: First sessions, revisiting CBT framework.

micro_actions.name: Providing Rationale for CBT Techniques
micro_actions.description: Explains purpose of interventions and exercises.
micro_actions.states: Introducing new tasks, patient is skeptical or confused.

micro_actions.name: Explaining the Thought-Emotion-Behavior Link
micro_actions.description: Uses metaphors/analogies to teach about interconnection.
micro_actions.states: Clarifying model, patient misunderstanding.

micro_actions.name: Checking Patient Understanding
micro_actions.description: Asks patient to paraphrase/explain the model.
micro_actions.states: After psychoeducation, before moving to application.

micro_actions.name: Normalizing Symptoms and Providing Hope
micro_actions.description: Reassures symptoms are common, fostering hope.
micro_actions.states: Stigma, shame, or hopelessness.

micro_actions.name: Challenge Self-Stigmatizing and Myth-Based Beliefs
micro_actions.description: Corrects misconceptions, gently debunks myths about mental health.
micro_actions.states: Patient repeats myths, expresses negative or stigmatizing attitudes.

micro_actions.name: Invite Discussion of Fears and Barriers
micro_actions.description: Encourages sharing therapy doubts, stigma, or ambivalence.
micro_actions.states: Patient is hesitant, ambivalent, or resistant.

micro_actions.name: Correcting Misconceptions
micro_actions.description: Addresses misinformation ('Itâ€™s a myth that panic attacks are always harmful').
micro_actions.states: Demoralization/misinformation disrupts engagement.

micro_actions.name: Inviting Patient Questions
micro_actions.description: Encourages patient to ask about process, expectations.
micro_actions.states: Early sessions, confusion or engagement barriers.

action_space.name: Identification and Evaluation of Automatic Thoughts
action_space.description: Helping patients recognize, articulate, and critically assess their automatic thoughts.
action_space.goal: Decrease distress and maladaptive behavior by modifying dysfunctional thinking.
action_space.states: Patient is distressed, describing problematic situations, emotional shifts, or cognitive distortions.

micro_actions.name: Eliciting Automatic Thoughts
micro_actions.description: Targeted questions such as 'What went through your mind when that happened?'
micro_actions.states: Distress, emotional shift, discussing challenging situations.

micro_actions.name: Prompt Record of Automatic Thoughts and Emotions
micro_actions.description: Therapist encourages thought records or diaries.
micro_actions.states: Recurring distress, struggles to recognize triggers.

micro_actions.name: Clarifying and Elaborating Thoughts
micro_actions.description: Prompts for fuller/specific thoughts ('Can you put that into a complete sentence?').
micro_actions.states: Vague, confused, or telegraphic responses.

micro_actions.name: Facilitate Thought Recording
micro_actions.description: Prompt verbal or written recording of automatic thoughts.
micro_actions.states: Critical incident discussion, difficulty identifying cognitions.

micro_actions.name: Distinguish Thought Types by Mood
micro_actions.description: Mood-specific questions to elicit thoughts ('What am I afraid might happen?').
micro_actions.states: Describing mood states or intense emotions.

micro_actions.name: Guide Thought 'Hotness' Rating
micro_actions.description: Encourage rating of intensity or 'hotness' of thoughts.
micro_actions.states: Worksheet use or prioritizing thoughts.

micro_actions.name: Guided Discovery and Socratic Questioning
micro_actions.description: Challenges thoughts with open evidence-based questions.
micro_actions.states: When thought needs evaluation.

micro_actions.name: Prompt Identification and Labeling of Thinking Errors
micro_actions.description: Prompt recording and naming of cognitive distortions.
micro_actions.states: Patient expresses negative emotions or rigid/unhelpful thoughts.

micro_actions.name: Guide Thought Record and Evidence Weighing
micro_actions.description: Ask patient to list evidence for/against a thought and self-rate conviction.
micro_actions.states: Stuck in negative automatic thought or uncertainty.

micro_actions.name: Rate Belief Strength and Emotional Impact
micro_actions.description: Ask for ratings on belief in thoughts and emotional response.
micro_actions.states: After identifying an automatic thought.

micro_actions.name: Linking Automatic Thoughts and Emotions
micro_actions.description: Relates thoughts to feelings ('What emotion did you feel when you had that thought?').
micro_actions.states: Clarifying cognitive-emotional link.

micro_actions.name: Summarize Insights
micro_actions.description: Support verbal summary of key automatic thoughts and insights.
micro_actions.states: After thought identification, verbal reviews.

action_space.name: Cognitive Restructuring, Distortion Challenging, and Guided Discovery
action_space.description: Using Socratic questioning and evidence examination to challenge and revise maladaptive automatic thoughts, core beliefs, and schemas.
action_space.goal: Facilitate adaptive, realistic thinking and decrease rigid or dysfunctional beliefs.
action_space.states: After automatic thought identification, when rigid beliefs, cognitive distortions, or schema-driven patterns emerge.

micro_actions.name: Socratic Questioning to Challenge Distortions/Beliefs
micro_actions.description: Use open-ended queries for evidence, alternative explanations, and balance.
micro_actions.states: Patient expresses rigid/extreme beliefs or distressing emotions.

micro_actions.name: Model and Suggest Alternative Interpretations
micro_actions.description: Prompt generation of balanced, less extreme meanings and reframes.
micro_actions.states: Difficulty considering other perspectives.

micro_actions.name: Encourage Recording and Reflection of New Thoughts
micro_actions.description: Write down or repeat alternative beliefs and compare emotional states.
micro_actions.states: After cognitive challenge/disputation.

micro_actions.name: Examine Evidence For and Against Thoughts/Beliefs
micro_actions.description: Prompt review of supporting/contradictory evidence.
micro_actions.states: Strong/distressing belief present.

micro_actions.name: Guide Evidence Collection
micro_actions.description: Record evidence for and against thoughts.
micro_actions.states: After thought identification.

micro_actions.name: Ask Structured Evidence-Seeking Questions
micro_actions.description: Repeatedly ask about evidence, peer perspectives, ignoring strengths.
micro_actions.states: Rigid/doubtful beliefs.

micro_actions.name: Decatastrophizing and Reattribution Questioning
micro_actions.description: Minimize catastrophic thinking, redistribute responsibility.
micro_actions.states: Catastrophizing, blame, or hopelessness.

micro_actions.name: Double Standard Technique
micro_actions.description: Ask if patient would judge a friend as harshly.
micro_actions.states: Over self-critical or perfectionistic rules.

micro_actions.name: Pros and Cons Analysis of Beliefs
micro_actions.description: List advantages/disadvantages of maintaining beliefs.
micro_actions.states: Impasse in changing core beliefs or ambivalence.

micro_actions.name: Imagery and Role-Play for Perspective Shifting
micro_actions.description: Use mental imagery or role play to challenge unhelpful cognitions.
micro_actions.states: Emotional activation or verbal discussion insufficient.

micro_actions.name: Model the Questioning Process/Peer Perspectives
micro_actions.description: Therapist demonstrates challenging a thought or uses peer examples.
micro_actions.states: Difficulty with evidence evaluation.

micro_actions.name: Facilitate Belief Rerating
micro_actions.description: Prompt re-rating of belief in thoughts and associated moods.
micro_actions.states: Post-restructuring exercise.

action_space.name: Identification and Modification of Core Beliefs and Schemas
action_space.description: Collaborative identification, evaluation, and restructuring of deeper attitudes, assumptions, and core beliefs.
action_space.goal: Promote lasting cognitive and emotional change by altering maladaptive belief systems.
action_space.states: After groundwork with automatic thoughts; beliefs central to ongoing distress.

micro_actions.name: Downward Arrow Questioning
micro_actions.description: Use prompts like 'If this is true, what does it mean about you?' to uncover deeper beliefs.
micro_actions.states: Exploring persistent distress, maladaptive thinking, unclear self-concept.

micro_actions.name: Sentence Completion for Core Beliefs
micro_actions.description: Guide patient to complete sentences articulating core beliefs.
micro_actions.states: Core belief elicitation.

micro_actions.name: Uncovering Core Beliefs (Downward Arrow Technique)
micro_actions.description: Probe deeper beliefs using Socratic questioning.
micro_actions.states: Recurring dysfunctional thinking or themes.

micro_actions.name: Evaluating Core Beliefs (Evidence Review)
micro_actions.description: Query for evidence supporting/contradicting beliefs.
micro_actions.states: After verbalizing core belief, belief testing exercises.

micro_actions.name: Collaborative Belief Reframing
micro_actions.description: Work together to develop more adaptive alternatives.
micro_actions.states: Following evidence review, modifying dysfunctional beliefs.

micro_actions.name: Tracking Belief Change
micro_actions.description: Ask for ratings of belief strength.
micro_actions.states: Following intervention or session closure.

micro_actions.name: Encourage Experience Recording for New Beliefs
micro_actions.description: Prompt documentation of experiences supporting positive beliefs.
micro_actions.states: Building evidence for new beliefs.

micro_actions.name: Confidence Rating of Core Beliefs
micro_actions.description: Rate confidence in new core beliefs (e.g., 0-100%).
micro_actions.states: Strengthening/review phases after new belief formulation.

micro_actions.name: Collaborative Schema Hypothesis Testing
micro_actions.description: List evidence supporting/refuting schemas.
micro_actions.states: Schema identified, emotional activation or ambivalence.

micro_actions.name: Normalize and Validate Emotional Responses around Schemas
micro_actions.description: Acknowledge and normalize emotional reactions while exploring schemas.
micro_actions.states: Distress, anxiety, or shame regarding deeper beliefs.

micro_actions.name: Encourage Articulation of Adaptive Beliefs
micro_actions.description: Prompt generation and reinforcement of healthy core beliefs.
micro_actions.states: Shifting schemas or readiness for new perspectives.

action_space.name: Behavioral Activation, Experimentation, and Skills Training
action_space.description: Planning and scheduling rewarding tasks, testing assumptions through behavioral experiments, and teaching adaptive skills to increase activity and coping.
action_space.goal: Reduce avoidance, improve mood, and foster adaptive coping.
action_space.states: Low mood, inactivity, skill deficits, or need for experiential evidence.

micro_actions.name: Scheduling and Reviewing Activities
micro_actions.description: Assign or review pleasurable/mastery tasks in collaboration.
micro_actions.states: Working on increasing activation or practicing coping skills.

micro_actions.name: Activity Scheduling and Discussion
micro_actions.description: Identify and plan rewarding/adaptive activities together.
micro_actions.states: Low mood, avoidance, lack of pleasure.

micro_actions.name: Brainstorm and Schedule Activities
micro_actions.description: List daily activities using worksheets, focusing on various domains.
micro_actions.states: Persistent low mood/avoidance, behavioral activation.

micro_actions.name: Break Down Tasks into Manageable Steps
micro_actions.description: Guide division of tasks into achievable components.
micro_actions.states: Overwhelmed or difficulty initiating tasks.

micro_actions.name: Track Planned and Completed Activities
micro_actions.description: Fill out worksheets and provide mood/enjoyment ratings.
micro_actions.states: Review of behavioral activation work.

micro_actions.name: Collaborative Coping Strategy Development
micro_actions.description: Brainstorm strategies for overcoming obstacles.
micro_actions.states: Planning, anticipating trouble maintaining activities.

micro_actions.name: Proposing Behavioral Experiments
micro_actions.description: Suggest tasks that test beliefs/predictions.
micro_actions.states: Expressing doubts, predicting negative outcomes, or testing beliefs.

micro_actions.name: Design Experiment and Review Obstacles
micro_actions.description: Define steps, anticipate problems, and plan coping strategies.
micro_actions.states: Experiment planning, motivating for assumption test.

micro_actions.name: Collaborative Experiment Planning
micro_actions.description: Determine with patient what would help test the belief.
micro_actions.states: Planning/initiating experiment.

micro_actions.name: Operationalizing Predictions
micro_actions.description: State clear, testable predictions before experiments.
micro_actions.states: Defining criteria for success/failure.

micro_actions.name: Grading Experiment Difficulty
micro_actions.description: Propose manageable steps or hierarchies.
micro_actions.states: Ambivalence or anxiety about experiment.

micro_actions.name: Exploring Doubts and Barriers
micro_actions.description: Discuss reservations or concerns.
micro_actions.states: Patient shows reluctance.

micro_actions.name: Providing Encouragement During Experiment
micro_actions.description: Praise/reassure during anxiety or struggle.
micro_actions.states: During experiment, patient anxious/struggling.

micro_actions.name: Modeling or Participating in Experiments
micro_actions.description: Therapist role-plays, demonstrates, or joins the experiment.
micro_actions.states: Patient needs support, demonstration, or in-session role-play.

micro_actions.name: Review Experiment Outcomes and Reflection
micro_actions.description: Review what happened and compare anticipated/actual outcomes.
micro_actions.states: Post experiment completion or exposure session.

micro_actions.name: Debrief Outcome and Reflect on Learning
micro_actions.description: Review experiment results and insights gained.
micro_actions.states: Post-experiment review, belief modification.

micro_actions.name: Facilitate Alternative Assumption Generation
micro_actions.description: Help articulate balanced alternatives after experiment.
micro_actions.states: Debriefing outcome/reflection.

micro_actions.name: Positive Reinforcement and Encouragement
micro_actions.description: Highlight achievements after completed activities.
micro_actions.states: Completed activities, skill practice, or progress.

micro_actions.name: Mastery and Pleasure Rating
micro_actions.description: Rate activities for mastery/pleasure, track affective change.
micro_actions.states: Behavioral activation exercises, review of tasks.

micro_actions.name: Troubleshooting and Problem-Solving Around Activities
micro_actions.description: Discuss barriers and adapt plans for task engagement.
micro_actions.states: Struggles, incomplete activities, reluctance.

micro_actions.name: Validate Choice and Normalize Flexibility
micro_actions.description: Discuss activity preferences and reassure about flexibility.
micro_actions.states: Patient uncertainty about categories.

micro_actions.name: Debrief Activity Outcomes and Encourage Reflection
micro_actions.description: Review activity records and reflect on learning and mood change.
micro_actions.states: Post-activity review, reinforcing learning.

action_space.name: Exposure Therapy and Response Prevention
action_space.description: Systematically exposing patients to feared stimuli or situations while preventing maladaptive responses/safety behaviors.
action_space.goal: Reduce anxiety, avoidance, and compulsions through habituation and adaptive coping.
action_space.states: Avoidance, compulsions, high anxiety, OCD, phobias, or readiness for behavioral work.

micro_actions.name: Guide Development of Exposure Hierarchy
micro_actions.description: List and rank feared situations/stimuli for graded exposures.
micro_actions.states: Multiple fears, avoidance, preparing for exposures.

micro_actions.name: Collaborative Exposure Hierarchy Creation
micro_actions.description: Create graded exposure list with difficulty ratings together.
micro_actions.states: Initial phase of exposure, patient expresses avoidance.

micro_actions.name: Coach Patient to Enter Feared Situations Without Safety Behaviors
micro_actions.description: Encourage facing fear without compulsive/avoidant actions.
micro_actions.states: Planned exposure, patient ready to confront fear.

micro_actions.name: Coach Exposure and Response Prevention
micro_actions.description: Support during exposure trials, prompt coping and avoid rituals.
micro_actions.states: In-session or homework exposure tasks.

micro_actions.name: Prompt Rating of Anticipated and Actual Anxiety
micro_actions.description: Rate expected/experienced anxiety before and after exposures.
micro_actions.states: Before and after exposure tasks.

micro_actions.name: Prompt Ratings of Anxiety and Symptom Similarity
micro_actions.description: Rate anxiety or compare symptoms numerically.
micro_actions.states: Completing/reviewing exposures.

micro_actions.name: Probe and Challenge Safety Behaviors
micro_actions.description: Question/identify safety or avoidance behaviors and encourage exposure without them.
micro_actions.states: Patient uses safety signals/avoidance during exposure.

micro_actions.name: Design Graded Exposure Practices with Clear Goals
micro_actions.description: Stepwise plan of increasing difficulty, define goals.
micro_actions.states: Undertaking exposure or revising plan.

micro_actions.name: Encourage Explicit Prediction and Likelihood Rating
micro_actions.description: Rate predicted negative outcome for each exposure step.
micro_actions.states: Beginning exposure task, preparing behavioral experiment.

micro_actions.name: Instruct Patient in Exposure Exercise Steps
micro_actions.description: Guide through planned exposures, remain focused, avoid distractions.
micro_actions.states: Ready to begin exposure session.

micro_actions.name: Prompt Objective Self-Focus during Exposure
micro_actions.description: Describe feelings/thoughts/environment during exercise.
micro_actions.states: Engaged in exposure, avoidance/distancing.

micro_actions.name: Lead Post-Exposure Debriefing
micro_actions.description: Review expectations vs outcomes and consolidate learning.
micro_actions.states: After exposures, during progress/mastery discussion.

micro_actions.name: Facilitate Discussion of Obstacles to Exposure
micro_actions.description: Identify and solve exposure-related barriers.
micro_actions.states: Patient struggles or expresses reluctance.

action_space.name: Emotional Differentiation, Mood Monitoring, and Emotional Regulation
action_space.description: Identifying, labeling, and tracking emotions; distinguishing healthy from unhealthy responses; teaching emotion regulation skills.
action_space.goal: Increase emotional awareness, foster adaptive regulation, and monitor progress.
action_space.states: Negative emotional experiences, difficulty identifying emotions, tracking mood, or emotional distress.

micro_actions.name: Prompt Naming and Description of Emotions
micro_actions.description: Ask patient to label current emotional state and describe characteristics.
micro_actions.states: Patient is vague, confused, or stuck in articulating feelings.

micro_actions.name: Offer and Clarify Emotional Vocabulary
micro_actions.description: Provide and differentiate emotion words, clarify nuances.
micro_actions.states: Struggles to find words for emotions.

micro_actions.name: Encourage Distress and Life Interference Ratings
micro_actions.description: Rate numerical intensity and impact of emotion.
micro_actions.states: Experiences distress, emotional self-monitoring.

micro_actions.name: Distinguish Moods from Thoughts
micro_actions.description: Prompt differentiation between feelings and thoughts.
micro_actions.states: Confusion between mood and thoughts, worksheet exercises.

micro_actions.name: Prompt Discussion of Healthy vs Unhealthy Emotional Responses
micro_actions.description: Consider whether response is adaptive or problematic.
micro_actions.states: Rigid, extreme, or dysfunctional emotion-driven behavior.

micro_actions.name: Guide Mood Rating
micro_actions.description: Rate mood intensity on a scale (e.g., 0-100).
micro_actions.states: Mood assessment, worksheet, emotional check-in.

micro_actions.name: Query Physical Sensations
micro_actions.description: Ask about somatic symptoms to link physical sensations and mood.
micro_actions.states: Difficulty identifying or distinguishing emotions, somatic distress.

micro_actions.name: Encourage Tracking and Reassessment
micro_actions.description: Remind to periodically reevaluate mood intensity over time.
micro_actions.states: Progress monitoring, relapse prevention, ongoing self-assessment.

action_space.name: Skills Training (Coping, Problem-Solving, and Emotion Regulation)
action_space.description: Teaching and reinforcing adaptive coping strategies such as mindfulness, relaxation, problem-solving, communication, assertiveness, and emotion regulation.
action_space.goal: Empower patient to independently manage distress, build resilience, and improve daily functioning.
action_space.states: Ongoing distress, exposure, skill deficits, reinforcement for skill use.

micro_actions.name: Direct Instruction of Coping Skills
micro_actions.description: Provide step-by-step skill instructions (e.g., mindful breathing, diaphragmatic breathing).
micro_actions.states: Patient unfamiliar with skill, practice or homework.

micro_actions.name: Modeling Target Skills
micro_actions.description: Demonstrate assertiveness, communication, or relaxation.
micro_actions.states: Patient needs concrete example before practice.

micro_actions.name: Guided Practice and Role Play
micro_actions.description: Coach through skill practice and role play in-session.
micro_actions.states: Patient needs rehearsal or feedback for new skill.

micro_actions.name: Coach Problem-Solving and Emotion Regulation
micro_actions.description: Model and prompt problem-solving and emotional regulation.
micro_actions.states: Feeling overwhelmed by problems or emotions.

micro_actions.name: Validate and Reinforce Skill Use
micro_actions.description: Reflect on and rate helpfulness of skills, validate mastery.
micro_actions.states: Skill review, relapse prevention, after skill practice.

micro_actions.name: Assigning and Reviewing Practice Homework
micro_actions.description: Assign specific skills for out-of-session practice and review logs.
micro_actions.states: Ready for skill application, reports difficulty.

micro_actions.name: Providing Feedback and Encouragement
micro_actions.description: Offer personalized feedback and praise for effort or improvement.
micro_actions.states: Skills practice in-session, uncertainty, reluctance.

action_space.name: Problem-Solving and Elimination of Counterproductive Coping
action_space.description: Defining problems, identifying unhealthy coping strategies, and developing adaptive solutions.
action_space.goal: Replace avoidance, suppression, and safety behaviors with constructive coping and acceptance.
action_space.states: Short-term coping perpetuates issues, patient faces practical life challenges.

micro_actions.name: Prompt Analysis of Problem and Coping Strategy
micro_actions.description: Discuss current coping and its consequences.
micro_actions.states: Avoidance, reassurance seeking, suppression, or counterproductive behaviors.

micro_actions.name: Guide Evaluation of Short-Term Relief vs Long-Term Costs
micro_actions.description: Discuss how coping strategies may perpetuate/worsen problems.
micro_actions.states: Articulates coping, receptive to exploring impact.

micro_actions.name: Encourage Development and Testing of Adaptive Solutions
micro_actions.description: Brainstorm/schedule alternative coping skills such as behavioral activation, problem-solving steps, or mindful redirection.
micro_actions.states: Open to replacing maladaptive coping or needs structure for new strategies.

action_space.name: Homework Assignment, Review, and Troubleshooting
action_space.description: Collaboratively setting, reviewing, and adjusting homework tasks to reinforce learning, facilitate skill generalization, and address obstacles.
action_space.goal: Promote progress between sessions, reinforce skills, and develop self-therapy abilities.
action_space.states: Session ending, homework review, or when non-adherence or difficulties arise.

micro_actions.name: Collaborative Homework Planning
micro_actions.description: Review options, seek agreement, and clarify assignments.
micro_actions.states: Session close, after practicing new technique, homework review.

micro_actions.name: Assign Homework Collaboratively
micro_actions.description: Invite patient input on homework formulation.
micro_actions.states: End of session, skill practice, learning reinforcement.

micro_actions.name: Assign Recordkeeping as Structured Homework
micro_actions.description: Set homework for structured recordkeeping.
micro_actions.states: Session conclusion, homework assignment.

micro_actions.name: Review Homework Completion and Barriers
micro_actions.description: Ask about completion, encountered obstacles, and lessons learned.
micro_actions.states: Start of session, homework review, assignments not completed.

micro_actions.name: Praise Effort and Partial Success
micro_actions.description: Verbal reinforcement for any progress in assignments.
micro_actions.states: Reviewing homework or progress, patient discouraged.

micro_actions.name: Collaborative Troubleshooting of Homework Difficulties
micro_actions.description: Problem-solve barriers to homework and generate solutions.
micro_actions.states: Non-completion or reported obstacles.

micro_actions.name: Troubleshooting Obstacles
micro_actions.description: Elicit and solve barriers to assignment completion.
micro_actions.states: Avoidance, reluctance, prior incomplete assignments.

micro_actions.name: Normalizing Setbacks and Reinforcing Homework as a Learning Process
micro_actions.description: Assure that imperfect completion is part of learning.
micro_actions.states: Frustration, self-criticism, anxiety about homework.

micro_actions.name: Reviewing Homework Assignments Stepwise
micro_actions.description: Ask for stepwise walk-through of assignments, challenges, and outcomes.
micro_actions.states: Start of session, discussing previous week.

action_space.name: Monitoring and Remediation of Session Difficulties
action_space.description: Identifying and resolving obstacles within therapy sessions such as alliance ruptures, structure breakdowns, or stuck points, via feedback and strategy adaptation.
action_space.goal: Resolve obstacles and ensure ongoing therapy effectiveness.
action_space.states: Progress stalls, outcomes unsatisfactory, barriers to collaboration or intervention arise.

micro_actions.name: Soliciting Direct Session Feedback
micro_actions.description: Ask about negative reactions or confusion regarding the session.
micro_actions.states: Progress stalls, suspected alliance rupture, after introducing interventions.

micro_actions.name: Addressing Nonverbal and Indirect Cues
micro_actions.description: Check in after observing disengagement or frustration.
micro_actions.states: Negative nonverbal behavior, emotional shift.

micro_actions.name: Clarifying Rationale and Adapting Strategies
micro_actions.description: Explain structure and invite negotiation for more comfortable approaches.
micro_actions.states: Patient pushes back, confusion, session structure breakdown.

micro_actions.name: Explicit Request for Patient Summary
micro_actions.description: Ask for patientâ€™s summary of understanding or feelings.
micro_actions.states: Patient confused, skeptical, or session is complex.

action_space.name: Relapse Prevention and Maintenance Planning
action_space.description: Preparing for therapy termination, setbacks, and maintaining gains through proactive planning and skill rehearsal.
action_space.goal: Reduce relapse risk, empower patient for long-term health and autonomy.
action_space.states: Symptoms remit, final sessions, maintenance/relapse prevention phases, or proactive planning needed.

micro_actions.name: Expectation Setting for Setbacks
micro_actions.description: Normalize setbacks and outline plans for coping.
micro_actions.states: Late stage, booster, or termination-preparation sessions.

micro_actions.name: Encouraging Review and Use of CBT Tools
micro_actions.description: Prompt summary and future planning using learned strategies.
micro_actions.states: Preparing for termination or reviewing progress.

micro_actions.name: Role-Playing Responses to Setbacks
micro_actions.description: Guide patient in imagining or rehearsing coping responses to future challenges.
micro_actions.states: Anticipating setbacks, high-risk situations.

micro_actions.name: Assigning Coping Card/Homework for Maintenance
micro_actions.description: Encourage creation of reminders for future challenges.
micro_actions.states: Relapse prevention planning and homework assignment.

micro_actions.name: Guide Skill Rating and Checklist Completion
micro_actions.description: Rate use and helpfulness of specific CBT skills, review worksheets.
micro_actions.states: Relapse prevention sessions, skill reviews, declines in engagement.

micro_actions.name: Prompt Reflection on High-Risk Areas and Early Warning Signs
micro_actions.description: Identify anticipated risk areas and plan coping strategies.
micro_actions.states: Near therapy completion or reviewing maintenance strategies.

micro_actions.name: Identify High-Risk Situations and Early Warning Signs
micro_actions.description: Articulate personal high-risk situations and early signs.
micro_actions.states: Planning for maintenance, vulnerability, skill generalization.

micro_actions.name: Collaborative Relapse Plan Development
micro_actions.description: Write or discuss detailed plan for relapse moments and rehearse coping plans.
micro_actions.states: Anticipating setbacks or future risk.

micro_actions.name: Normalize Setbacks and Encourage Compassionate Self-Talk
micro_actions.description: Normalize setbacks and encourage self-supportive narration.
micro_actions.states: Concerns about relapse, self-criticism, or setback occurs.

micro_actions.name: Encourage Continued Mood/Symptom Self-Monitoring
micro_actions.description: Prompt ongoing tracking of mood, symptoms, and self-assessment.
micro_actions.states: Maintenance sessions, post skill acquisition, when monitoring critical.

micro_actions.name: Support Planning for Ongoing Behavioral Activation and Social Connection
micro_actions.description: Ask about plans for ongoing activities, social engagement, and CBT strategy review.
micro_actions.states: Establishing routines, post-therapy life.

micro_actions.name: Facilitate Crisis Planning and External Help-Seeking
micro_actions.description: Create plan for contacting trusted individuals/professionals if problems re-emerge.
micro_actions.states: At risk for crisis, low mood, future uncertainty.

micro_actions.name: Rehearsing Coping Strategies
micro_actions.description: Role play or review responses to setbacks.
micro_actions.states: Concluding sessions, anticipated stressors.

micro_actions.name: Developing Relapse Management Plans
micro_actions.description: Formalize coping statements and action plans for when old patterns return.
micro_actions.states: Final phase, consolidating progress.

micro_actions.name: Review and Celebration of Achievements
micro_actions.description: Summarize progress, reinforce achievements, build post-therapy confidence.
micro_actions.states: End of therapy, goal completion.

micro_actions.name: Discussing Follow-up and Support Options
micro_actions.description: Explain support resources and how to seek help post-therapy.
micro_actions.states: Termination phase, need for ongoing support.

action_space.name: Suicide Risk Assessment and Safety Planning
action_space.description: Assessing risk factors, building safety commitment, and creating crisis management plans collaboratively.
action_space.goal: Reduce imminent risk, increase safety, and foster hope in treatment.
action_space.states: Patients expressing suicidality, hopelessness, or high risk for self-harm.

micro_actions.name: Direct Inquiry about Suicidal Thoughts and Behaviors
micro_actions.description: Ask explicit questions about suicidal ideation, plans, and history.
micro_actions.states: Patient expresses hopelessness, suicidal ideation, or history of attempts.

micro_actions.name: Direct Assessment of Risk Factors
micro_actions.description: Ask targeted questions for suicidality, self-harm, substance use.
micro_actions.states: Mood disturbance, crisis, risk indicators or changed status.

micro_actions.name: Explore Reasons for Living and Protective Factors
micro_actions.description: Identify personal values and positive motivations.
micro_actions.states: Safety planning, after risk disclosure, crisis intervention.

micro_actions.name: Collaborative Safety Plan Development
micro_actions.description: Co-create detailed safety plans discussing steps and resources.
micro_actions.states: Session after risk identification or updating management strategies.

micro_actions.name: Affirm and Debrief Emotional Responses
micro_actions.description: Express support and process emotions after discussing risk.
micro_actions.states: After discussion of suicide or crisis, emotional lability.

micro_actions.name: Troubleshoot Barriers to Safety
micro_actions.description: Address obstacles to safety plan adherence and generate alternatives.
micro_actions.states: Safety plan review, doubts, or low motivation.

action_space.name: Involving Significant Others in Treatment
action_space.description: Structuring helper involvement, educating significant others, and adjusting relational/support patterns to foster independence.
action_space.goal: Promote constructive support, teamwork, and patient autonomy.
action_space.states: Patient has helpers involved in avoidance or coping, ready for supported exposure.

micro_actions.name: Educate Helpers about Anxiety and Support Roles
micro_actions.description: Explain nature of anxiety, constructive responses, and avoiding magnifying anxiety.
micro_actions.states: Helper present or incorporated into treatment planning.

micro_actions.name: Model Supportive Helper Statements and Actions
micro_actions.description: Suggest ratings and specific support keywords over distress-focused questions.
micro_actions.states: Joint exercises, practice sessions, helper role-play.

micro_actions.name: Review and Adjust Unhelpful Support Patterns
micro_actions.description: Identify and modify excessive reassurance, enabling avoidance, or insensitive responses.
micro_actions.states: Helper/patient reports problematic dynamics.

micro_actions.name: Plan and Structure Graduated Joint Exposure Exercises
micro_actions.description: Develop stepwise exposure plans involving patient and helper.
micro_actions.states: Helper available/willing, patient needs support for exposure.

micro_actions.name: Promote Patient Independence while Transitioning Support
micro_actions.description: Gradually shift responsibility from helper to patient, reinforce autonomy.
micro_actions.states: Patient shows progress, helper involvement tapered.

action_space.name: Medication Management and Integration with CBT Skills
action_space.description: Guiding education about medications, supporting safe withdrawal and integrating coping strategies when adjusting medication.
action_space.goal: Empower patient to safely manage medication with CBT, maintain progress without reliance.
action_space.states: Patient using medication, considering withdrawal, or experiencing medication side effects.

micro_actions.name: Provide Information about Medication Function and Side Effects
micro_actions.description: Explain medication purpose, expected side effects, and withdrawal process.
micro_actions.states: Prescribed medication or expressed questions.

micro_actions.name: Normalize and Reassure about Medication Side Effects
micro_actions.description: Emphasize normality and transient nature of most side effects.
micro_actions.states: Reports side effects, worries about withdrawal.

micro_actions.name: Encourage Physician Consultation for Medication Changes
micro_actions.description: Remind patient to consult prescriber for dose changes or withdrawal.
micro_actions.states: Considering dose change or expresses uncertainty.

micro_actions.name: Integrate CBT Coping Skills during Medication Changes
micro_actions.description: Prompt use of breathing, cognitive restructuring, and monitoring during withdrawal.
micro_actions.states: Experiencing withdrawal/symptoms or transitioning to CBT-only.

micro_actions.name: Frame Withdrawal Symptoms as Opportunities for Skill Practice
micro_actions.description: Reassure that withdrawal symptoms signify adjustment and can be managed using CBT skills.
micro_actions.states: Interprets withdrawal as failure or relapse.

action_space.name: Coping Skills Training, Forgiveness, and Compassion-Focused Reflection
action_space.description: Teaching mindfulness, relaxation, problem-solving, emotion regulation, and facilitating reflection on forgiveness and compassion toward self and others.
action_space.goal: Empower independent distress management, build resilience, and promote emotional healing.
action_space.states: Ongoing distress, need for exposure, unresolved anger, guilt, shame, or relationship difficulties.

micro_actions.name: Prompt Use of Mindfulness and Relaxation
micro_actions.description: Instruct in skills like mindful breathing, progressive muscle relaxation.
micro_actions.states: Acute distress, anxious arousal, practicing skills.

micro_actions.name: Explore Specific Harms or Self-Blame
micro_actions.description: Invite description of past harms, impact, and emotional effects.
micro_actions.states: Reflecting on self-criticism or interpersonal problems.

micro_actions.name: Guide Imagining Forgiveness
micro_actions.description: Prompt imagination of positive outcomes of forgiveness or compassion.
micro_actions.states: Ambivalence or stuck in anger/guilt/shame.

micro_actions.name: Facilitate Perspective-Taking
micro_actions.description: Consider reasons behind behaviors or alternative interpretations.
micro_actions.states: Rigid or one-sided interpretations regarding harm/blame.

micro_actions.name: Encourage Articulation of Positive Self-Qualities
micro_actions.description: Identify and verbalize positive qualities or strengths for healing.
micro_actions.states: Low self-esteem, severe self-criticism, persistent shame/guilt.

micro_actions.name: Prompt Forgiveness/Compassion Letter or Statement
micro_actions.description: Invite writing or rehearsing forgiveness statements as exercise.
micro_actions.states: Ready to work on forgiveness.

action_space.name: Objective Self-Monitoring and Recordkeeping
action_space.description: Systematically and objectively record symptoms, mood, triggers, and coping throughout treatment.
action_space.goal: Enable accurate self-observation, identification of triggers, track progress, and support personalized interventions.
action_space.states: Beginning treatment, experiencing anxiety/panic, skill development, or ongoing monitoring.

micro_actions.name: Instruct Patient in Use of Monitoring Forms
micro_actions.description: Explain and demonstrate use of records, prompt completion after episodes or daily.
micro_actions.states: New to therapy or recently experienced episode.

micro_actions.name: Validate Discomfort with Recordkeeping
micro_actions.description: Acknowledge and normalize resistance or discomfort with keeping records.
micro_actions.states: Expresses frustration, discomfort, or resistance.

micro_actions.name: Clarify Objective vs Subjective Recording
micro_actions.description: Explain value of noting external details and internal feelings.
micro_actions.states: Confuses distinction between details vs feelings during recordkeeping.

micro_actions.name: Prompt Daily End-of-Day Mood Recording
micro_actions.description: Remind to record mood ratings and relevant events daily.
micro_actions.states: Establishing daily self-monitoring habits.

micro_actions.name: Review Completed Records Collaboratively
micro_actions.description: Guide review of recorded data, highlight patterns, and identify areas for improvement.
micro_actions.states: Session involves homework review, record discussion.

micro_actions.name: Reinforce Value and Benefits of Recordkeeping
micro_actions.description: Emphasize how self-monitoring supports awareness and progress.
micro_actions.states: Doubts about usefulness or inconsistent recording.

Conversation_states.Description: Current emotional state or affect (e.g., sadness, anxiety, anger, hope), including intensity and quality. Guides intervention choice, pacing, and tracks shifts during session.
Conversation_states.Numerical values: 0.0 = neutral/calm/no distress, 1.0 = very distressed/strong negative mood; values in between reflect gradations of emotional intensity.

Conversation_states.Description: Degree to which emotional distress is present and disrupts function or therapeutic progress in session. Used to select interventions and monitor safety.
Conversation_states.Numerical values: 0.0 = no distress/no interference, 1.0 = extreme distress/maximum interference; intermediate values reflect partial distress or interference.

Conversation_states.Description: Overall intensity and severity of clinical symptoms (e.g., depression, anxiety, suicidality, insomnia). Used to track progress and adjust interventions.
Conversation_states.Numerical values: 0.0 = asymptomatic/no symptoms, 1.0 = severely symptomatic/intense; intermediate values reflect mild to moderate symptom presence.

Conversation_states.Description: Strength and quality of collaboration, mutual trust, and rapport between therapist and patient. Directly influences engagement and intervention success.
Conversation_states.Numerical values: 0.0 = no alliance/ruptured, 1.0 = strong/protective alliance; intermediate scores reflect partial or improving rapport.

Conversation_states.Description: Degree of patientâ€™s active involvement, collaboration, and completion of session tasks and homework. Indicator of motivation and alliance.
Conversation_states.Numerical values: 0.0 = disengaged/passive, 1.0 = fully engaged/collaborative/fully compliant; values in between reflect partial engagement.

Conversation_states.Description: Degree to which planned agenda items, problems, and behavioral goals are addressed and completed. Guides session structure and prioritization.
Conversation_states.Numerical values: 0.0 = no progress/unfinished, 1.0 = full achievement/all items completed; intermediate values indicate partial completion.

Conversation_states.Description: Presence, frequency, clarity, and emotional intensity of automatic thoughts identified and discussed in-session. Central for cognitive interventions.
Conversation_states.Numerical values: 0.0 = no/unclear thoughts, 1.0 = many/specific/highly salient; intermediate values indicate some identifiable automatic thoughts.

Conversation_states.Dimension Name: Degree of Belief/Conviction in Automatic/Core Thoughts
Conversation_states.Description: How strongly patient believes identified automatic, core, or alternative thoughts (including both intellectual and emotional certainty). Guides restructuring focus.
Conversation_states.Numerical values: 0.0 = no belief, 1.0 = full certainty/conviction; values in between represent partial endorsement.

Conversation_states.Description: Frequency and intensity of distorted, dysfunctional or biased thinking patterns (e.g., catastrophizing, black-and-white, mindreading) present in session. Informs cognitive restructuring targets.
Conversation_states.Numerical values: 0.0 = no distortions, 1.0 = strong/persistent/pervasive distortions; intermediate values indicate occasional errors.

Conversation_states.Description: Strength and presence of activation of underlying schemas, core, or intermediate beliefs. Focus for deeper CBT work.
Conversation_states.Numerical values: 0.0 = inactive/absent, 1.0 = fully activated/discussed; intermediate values reflect partial activation.

Conversation_states.Description: How fixed or open the patientâ€™s beliefs (core or automatic) are. Influences ability to consider alternatives and adapt cognitively.
Conversation_states.Numerical values: 0.0 = fully rigid/inflexible, 1.0 = highly flexible/adaptive; intermediate values reflect partial flexibility.

Conversation_states.Description: Ability to generate, consider and rate alternative, adaptive thoughts or objective appraisals. Indicates openness to change.
Conversation_states.Numerical values: 0.0 = none/inflexible, 1.0 = consistently demonstrates flexibility/balanced evidence evaluation; intermediate values indicate partial objectivity.

Conversation_states.Description: Nature of immediate behaviors in response to emotion or cognitive content (e.g., avoidance, reassurance seeking, engagement, social withdrawal).
Conversation_states.Numerical values: 0.0 = healthy/adaptive, 1.0 = problem-maintaining/maladaptive; intermediate values reflect mixed or partial responses.

Conversation_states.Description: Frequency and strength of avoidance, escape, or safety behaviors that reduce exposure but maintain anxiety/distress. Guides exposure and behavioral activation.
Conversation_states.Numerical values: 0.0 = none/absent, 1.0 = strong/persistent/pervasive, constant use; intermediate values reflect occasional behaviors.

Conversation_states.Description: Frequency and quality of adaptive coping or emotion regulation strategies learned in CBT (e.g., relaxation, breathing, problem-solving) used in and between sessions.
Conversation_states.Numerical values: 0.0 = not used/ineffective, 1.0 = consistently used/effective; intermediate values denote partial or developing skill usage.

Conversation_states.Description: Presence and severity of behaviors that maintain distress or interfere with progress (e.g., inactivity, distraction, passivity, rumination).
Conversation_states.Numerical values: 0.0 = absent/none, 1.0 = persistent/frequent/intense; intermediate values indicate occasional maladaptive behaviors.

Conversation_states.Description: Degree of preoccupation with negative automatic thoughts, repetitive passive thinking (rumination, worry), or intrusive thoughts.
Conversation_states.Numerical values: 0.0 = none, 1.0 = persistent/intense/absorbing; intermediate values indicate moderate engagement.

Conversation_states.Description: Amount of session time remaining and resource use relative to agenda and patient needs. Guides pacing and prioritization.
Conversation_states.Numerical values: 0.0 = time overrun/poor use, 1.0 = optimal time/resource use; intermediate values indicate partial efficiency.

Conversation_states.Description: Degree to which patient has executed assigned homework, behavioral experiments, or self-monitoring tasks; reflects accountability and learning.
Conversation_states.Numerical values: 0.0 = not completed/no effort, 1.0 = fully completed/thorough effort/high quality; intermediate values reflect partial effort or completion.

Conversation_states.Dimension Name: Barriers, Obstacles, Setbacks, and Resistance Level
Conversation_states.Description: Presence, type, and intensity of practical, psychological, or motivational obstacles impeding homework or session progress, including resistance to change or setbacks.
Conversation_states.Numerical values: 0.0 = none/no resistance, 1.0 = severe/multiple obstacles/setbacks; intermediate values indicate some barriers or resistance.

Conversation_states.Description: Patientâ€™s explicit and implicit feedback (verbal and nonverbal) regarding process, interventions, and therapist; guides in-session adaptation.
Conversation_states.Numerical values: 0.0 = negative/no feedback, 1.0 = positive/comprehensive feedback; intermediate values reflect ambiguous or partial feedback.

Conversation_states.Description: Patientâ€™s ability, frequency, and quality of applying CBT skills (e.g., thought restructuring, worksheets, emotion regulation) in session and homework.
Conversation_states.Numerical values: 0.0 = no acquisition/use/never practiced/poor quality, 1.0 = mastery/frequent use/consistent/high quality; intermediate values indicate developing skill or partial usage.

Conversation_states.Description: Patientâ€™s readiness, motivation, openness, and confidence to engage in planned changes, behavioral experiments, or homework.
Conversation_states.Numerical values: 0.0 = unmotivated/unconfident/not willing, 1.0 = highly motivated/very confident/fully willing; intermediate values reflect ambivalence or partial readiness.

Conversation_states.Description: Patientâ€™s advancement toward agreed-upon behavioral and emotional goals or session objectives; may be therapist-rated or self-reported.
Conversation_states.Numerical values: 0.0 = no progress/regression, 1.0 = significant progress/goal achievement/plan fully completed; intermediate values reflect partial achievement.

Conversation_states.Description: Patientâ€™s understanding, acceptance, and identification with the individualized therapeutic/cognitive model (e.g., anxiety cycle, thought-behavior-emotion links).
Conversation_states.Numerical values: 0.0 = no resonance/rejection/little understanding, 1.0 = full acceptance/resonance/full understanding; intermediate values reflect partial grasp.

Conversation_states.Description: Degree to which patient follows prescribed session structure (e.g., form completion, agenda-setting, updates/tasks).
Conversation_states.Numerical values: 0.0 = noncompliant/not followed, 1.0 = fully compliant/all tasks followed; intermediate values indicate partial compliance.

Conversation_states.Description: Signs of physical activation or distress (e.g., heart rate, agitation, tension, sleep disturbance, fatigue) during session; useful for risk and emotional state monitoring.
Conversation_states.Numerical values: 0.0 = none/calm, 1.0 = severe/high arousal/frequent symptoms/intense sensations; intermediate values reflect mild symptoms.

Conversation_states.Description: Presence and severity of warning signs for relapse, suicidal ideation, crisis, or risk-related behaviors; determines urgency and safety planning.
Conversation_states.Numerical values: 0.0 = no risk, 1.0 = high/imminent risk; intermediate values indicate potential warnings or mild risk.

Conversation_states.Description: Allocation of attention (e.g., self-focused, task-focused, environment-focused, threat monitoring, internal body scanning).
Conversation_states.Numerical values: 0.0 = fully task/environment/external, 1.0 = fully self/threat-focused/internal just symptom scanning; intermediate values reflect shifting focus.

Conversation_states.Description: Quality and frequency of social interactions, assertiveness, withdrawal, support network use, and relationship quality; informs therapy focus.
Conversation_states.Numerical values: 0.0 = isolated/socially impaired/high conflict, 1.0 = highly engaged/assertive/fully supported/full harmony; intermediate values reflect partial functioning or engagement.

Conversation_states.Description: Current phase of therapy or position in anxiety/panic cycle (e.g., assessment, skills training, exposure, cognitive restructuring, onset/peak/resolution). Directs session planning and pacing.
Conversation_states.Numerical values: 0.0 = start/onset/assessment, 1.0 = completion/maintenance/peak; intermediate values represent partial progress through stages.

knowledge_graph.description: Root node representing the individual in CBT treatment.
Age, gender, cultural, educational, religious, vocational, and developmental background.
Psychiatric and medical diagnoses, comorbidities, DSM dimensions, evolving conditions.
Primary emotional, cognitive, behavioral, and physiological symptoms and challenges.
Persistent and variable symptoms, including objective scores, onset, duration, severity, and episodic course.
Impairments in daily life, work, social, and relationship functioning due to psychological symptoms.
Enduring beliefs about self, others, world; confidence ratings; origins; changes over time.
Enduring schema themes (self-worth, adequacy, vulnerability, perfectionism); adaptive/maladaptive schema inventory.
Personal rules and assumptions connecting core beliefs to thoughts/actions.
Maladaptive 'If...then...' rules and alternative assumptions.
Beliefs about thinking, worry, uncertainty, and thoughtâ€“action fusion.
Recurring automatic thoughts, triggers, cognitive distortions, cataloging, and their effects.
Patterns of distorted thinking (e.g., catastrophizing, jumping to conclusions, negative predictions).
Record of rational responses and alternative adaptive thoughts.
Maladaptive schemas, repeating belief themes, perfectionistic/self-defeating tendencies, and narrative patterns.
Style of attributing events: internal/external, global/specific.
Patterns of emotional responses, vocabulary, intensity, and emotion-labeling ability.
History and progression of emotional problems (depression, anxiety, anger, shame, guilt, etc.).
Daily progression and fluctuation of mood ratings.
Patterns in symptoms, compulsions, triggers, including phobic/avoidant behaviors.
History of activity/inactivity, avoidance, mastery, pleasure, schedule adherence, procrastination.
Catalogue and patterns of avoidance, compulsions, reassurance-seeking, unhealthy coping.
Adaptive or alternative coping responses, compensatory strategies, behavioral experiments.
Adaptive and maladaptive coping behaviors, self-reinforcement, relaxation, mindfulness, and problem-solving.
Acquired coping skills and shifts in coping approaches.
Strategies for dealing with schemas, perfectionism, dependency, avoidance.
Persistent/situation-specific safety behaviors, avoidance, and associated rituals.
Records and logs of symptom improvement, relapse, homework adherence, and self-assessment tools.
Significant others/helpers involved and their impact.
Family structure, social environment, relationship stressors/supports, joint exposures.
Significant relationships, family/support network, therapy engagement.
Relationship quality, assertiveness, trust, patterns of interpersonal coping.
Learning style, intellectual level, motivation, strengths, values.
Childhood, family, trauma, education, significant formative influences.
Significant life events, trauma, losses, critical incidents, and their impact.
Family structure, support systems, social environment, involvement/support of significant others.
Concrete/personal goals, values, life purpose, goal progression and values-based actions.
Progress towards goals, markers of achievement, setbacks, and engagement.
Collaboratively set goals; revisions; tracking and attainment.
CBT action plans, history, steps, obstacles, and progress/outcomes.
Quantitative and qualitative measures of CBT progress, outcome scores, and residual impairment.
History of relapse, triggers, barriers, relapse prevention skills/plans.
Skill acquisition, proficiency, use outside sessions, mastery of CBT techniques, progress tracking.
Acquisition and mastery of behavioral/cognitive skills and communication effectiveness.
Record of CBT techniques, interventions, behavioral experiments, role plays, and their effectiveness.
Details, design, outcomes, and impact of behavioral experiments and exposures.
Progress/accomplishment in graded exposure tasks (fear ladders, hierarchy steps).
Completed/planned practice activities, progression through exposure, mastery of skills.
Record of homework assignments, rationale, completion, barriers, methods, and efficacy.
Agenda setting, engagement issues, session adherence patterns.
Longitudinal data from standardized mood/anxiety inventories (BDI, BAI, PSWQ, MCQ-30, etc.).
Patient preferences, materials received, learning modalities.
History of medication use, adherence, substances, side effects, and attitudes toward medication.
Therapeutic effects, side effects, tolerance, and beliefs regarding medication.
Suicidality, self-harm history, substance use, acute/chronic risks, protective factors, risk management.
Ongoing acute/chronic risk management, including suicide/self-harm risk.
Course and chronicity of PTSD symptoms, remissions, relapses.
History of trauma, type, timing, severity, and complexity.
Historical, social, and environmental factors contributing to functioning and schema development.
Learning style, motivation, strengths, values, and barriers.
Previous therapy involvement, engagement, session attendance, preferences.
Acceptance of psychological problems, normalization attitudes, stigma.
Barriers to change, historical and current obstacles (avoidance, low motivation, dependence conflicts).
Themes/emotional responses to mental images, avoidance, coping strategies rehearsed with imagery.
